DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether atorvastatin 80mg reduce development myocardial edema follow coronary artery bypass surgery . This study also want determine : 1. whether atorvastatin 80mg influence Follistatin-like 1 ( FSTL1 ) plasma level follow bypass surgery ? 2. whether correlation myocardial edema FSTL1 plasma level ? 3. efficacy atorvastatin 80mg compare atorvastatin 10mg reduce hs-CRP ( high sensitive-C reactive protein ) MDA ( malondialdehyde ) plasma level follow bypass surgery ? 4. efficacy atorvastatin 80mg compare atorvastatin 10mg raise PKA PKB plasma level follow bypass surgery ?
DOC.detailed_description: This study double blind experimental study use parallel design . Study subject patient Harapan Kita hospital register CABG ( Coronary Artery Bypass Graft ) surgery fulfill eligibility criterion . The subject first consecutively select , male age 40-65 criterion . After investigator randomization block randomization method . All subject give drug label A label B ( pharmacist know dose atorvastatin belong label ) . Total subject need study 30 ( 15 belong study group 15 belong control group ) MRI ( Magnetic Resonance Imaging ) result read two radiologist , analyze use cronbach alpha . The result consider equal cronbach > 0,7 . If proven unequal , third radiologist decide . Statin known several adverse effect , myopathy , myositis rhabdomyolysis , elevate liver enzyme , memory loss , GI ( gastrointestinal ) disturbance , severa others . Therefore , investigator check baseline CK ( creatine kinase ) liver enzyme begin study , surgery , patient feel symptom . Statin stop patient decide stop , increase ALT ( alanine aminotransferase ) high three time upper normal value , increase CK high ten time upper normal value . Statistical analysis use IBM SPSS statistic version 21.0 . Comparative analysis variable smoke history , obesity , hypertension , dyslipidemia , diabetes , family history , infarct history , ACE-I/ARB ( angiotensin convert enzyme inihibitor /angiotensin receptor blocker ) therapy use chi-square fischer . Comparative analysis variable T2 relaxation time , FSTL1 , hs-CRP , PKA ( protein kinase A ) , PKB ( Protein Kinase B ) , MDA , age , CPB ( Cardiopulmonary Bypass ) time , CABG time use unpaired t-test Mann-whitney . Correlative analysis FSTL1 T2 relaxation time use Pearson test .
DOC.criteria: Patients coronary artery disease indicate CABG surgery sign inform consent high risk EURO ( European System Cardiac Operative Risk Evaluation ) score creatinin value > 2 g/dl direct bilirubin value > 3 mg/ml AST/ALT ( aspartate transaminase / alanine transaminase ) value > 1,5 time UNL ( upper normal limit ) high preoperative CKMB ( Creatine KinaseMB ) troponin LVEF ( Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction ) < 45 % concomitant valve disease require surgery contraindicate MRI high degree ventricular arrhytmia coagulation disorder COPD ( chronic obsructive pulmonary disease ) HIV ( Human Immunodeficiency Virus ) + , HBV ( Hepatitis B Virus ) + , HCV ( Hepatitis C Virus ) + conduction abnormality , pacemaker electrolyte blood gas disturbance receive immunosuppressive drug cytotoxic agent 4 week surgery receive macrolide , azole antifungal , fibrate , protease inhibitor HIV drug
